review.reviewBody: Nice quality materials and construction. But lacks an insert to wipe your nose on. As well, cold wind leaks around the finger seams a bit and the insulation makes getting the gloves on a bit fussy. IMO pretty good, not perfect, and not worth the price.
review.name: Expensive for warmth

review.reviewBody:
I’ll start out by saying I have small hands, and short fingers.

Bought a small based on sizing guide. Could bare fit in them. 

Had them replaced with a Medium (excellent customer service!) — the fingers are still so short that it feels like I have webbed hands.

Much more usable — but I’d order TWO SIZES UP from what you think you wear (and what Gorewear’s chart tells you).

Everything is wonderfully warm, windproof, and waterproof.

Keeping them, but they’ll only be used on my bike; not when walking around.
review.name: Ideal features. Embarrassingly Small.

name: Endure GORE-TEX Insulated Glove - Men's

review.reviewBody:
My friend's five-year-old little guy wore these on his first day ever skiing in Park City on a mild winter day. He loved them! He layered well underneath and wore the matching jacket as a kit. He looked and and felt like a pro (and adorable). He said he was happy and comfortable all day and had the best day ripping around the slope. These are more everyday to mild day bottoms, but if you add the proper layers it will keep your child warm and protected from the elements. The top bib piece keeps snow from sneaking in and adds warmth/extra protection from the elements. 
He is five-years-old and average to slightly smaller for his age, and the 5T fit him perfectly with room to layer. We loved that you can adjust the length longer as your child grows, making these last significantly longer than they otherwise would, especially on the lower end of the spectrum.
review.name: Great Everyday Bibs

name: Rider 2 Insulated Bib Pant - Toddlers'

review.reviewBody: This shirt is a little thicker in weight than I expected. But it is so soft. I wore it out in somewhat colder PNW weather and it was perfect over a camisole. Was hoping to buy another but it may no longer be available.
review.name: Super comfy shirt

review.reviewBody: I live in the desert, love to be outdoors, and recently had a melanoma removed, so I need to cover up. I use my long-sleeved, white cotton gauze shirt to ride my trail bike, leaving it open, flapping in the breeze. It keeps the sun off and is plenty cool, even midday in summer. It's a plus that the flapping helps visibility on road sections. Just wish these shirts came in some pastel colors. I'd buy more!
review.name: Best Biking Shirt

review.reviewBody: I love the soft gauzy fabric and fit of this shirt. I plan to use it as a top layer for evenings on vacation and summer work in an over-air conditioned office. The egret color is a delicate off-white that will go with anything. Definitely a boxy fit, but it looks cute - modern and a bit oversized with a super soft feel.
review.name: Perfect gauzy summer button-up

review.reviewBody: I ordered this shirt on June 28th and have still not received it on July 14th. I requested shipping status and they couldn't help. They just told me it will arrive when it arrives. I would not recommend purchasing from this site again.
review.name: Item never received
comment: We apologize for the delay with your shirt order and understand your frustration. We’ve reached out via email with more details and are working to resolve this shipping issue. Thank you for your patience while we address the situation.

review.reviewBody: It's not the airy summer shirt I was thinking of, the material is rather thick for being cotton gauze, but it's a nice shirt regardless, though more suitable for cooler weather.
review.name: Quite thick

review.reviewBody: I wanted a button up top that was dressy enough to wear to work but causal enough to wear out with friends. This definitely fits the bill, it's comfortable and lightweight but it is a smidge boxy which is what is holding me back from giving it a full 5 stars.
review.name: Great, casual button up top

review.reviewBody: This shirt is exactly what one would hope for in a light weight, stylish, and practical shirt for warm or hot sunny days or even cooler days. It is perfect for casual wearing or for hiking, walking or over a bathing suit. It washes beautifully in warm or cold ( my preference ) water and very little shrinkage. I use a dryer on warm for about 15 min. ( it could be longer ) to let it unfold from the washing. I then hang it to let it dry. It comes out as beautiful as when I first bought it. I usually buy a large shirt depending on the brand, but I bought a M which is perfect. I like my shirts like this one a bit roomy because I often wear shirts under a button down shirt. I bought the Nantucket breeze color which is very light, more of a light aqua and lovely.
review.name: Excellent shirt.

review.reviewBody: I bought the white Basin and Range version last summer and love it! It runs a bit big, but thats the over-sized style. I bought the XS but I am typically buy smalls in most tops. It does shrink quite a bit when washed- but I still love the fit! The fabric is really comfy and honestly warmer that I thought it would be. Just ordered the "fossil" color Backcounty  version and its exactly the same! LOVE IT!
review.name: Great go-to

name: Cotton Gauze Long-Sleeve Button-Down - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Pictures look better than real shoes.  Compared to another pair a month before, this model doesn’t look as good quality and  as comfortable, probably its tongue ruins the whole shoe. I wouldn’t wear it for hiking.
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was looking for water proof shoes and this one popped up in my search. It was on sale so I decided to give it a try, plus Columbia is a highly trusted brand for hiking accessories. The color is pretty in person and I tested it during my hike by crossing the shallow river. It was water proof outside. However, the bottom is not really anti slippery but does the job balancing me while hiking on rocks and rough are. Left shoe was a little snug and firm than the right one, even after I adjusted the laces. Maybe it needs to be worn more to be more flexible. Overall I am pleased with my purchase.
review.name: Good hiking shoes and affordable price.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Bought these because I have an upcoming trip to Alaska. I broke them in already and they are very comfortable and passed the puddle test so far!
review.name: Comfy and waterproof

review.reviewBody: I bought this back in June for a trip to Alaska September 1.  I bought them because they are supposed to be waterproof. I’ve worn them occasionally to break them in-but it has been dry until yesterday. I got caught in a pouring rain, and my feet were soaked-and it seems like they are going to take forever to dry. I’ve had other leather waterproof boots from Columbia, and they were great. I went with the mesh style because they are lighter. I don’t know what I’m going to do as I dont have time to shop for another pair before I go to Alaska and it is their rainy season.
review.name: These are not waterproof!!!
comment: Thank you so much for taking the time to provide your feedback! If you would like to see what options you have in this case, Please reach out to our Customer care for assistance.  Thank you for choosing Columbia!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I've had my Columbia hiking shoes for a couple of weeks, and they've already outperformed my previous pairs. On a recent trip to Yellowstone and the Tetons, I noticed a huge difference. My old hiking shoes would slip on wet rocks, and my foot would often slip out, making me feel unstable. With these Columbias, I felt secure and confident—no slipping, just solid traction and a snug fit. If you're tired of shoes that don't hold up, these are a game-changer. Highly recommended! They do run a bit longer than expected, giving my toes some extra wiggle room, but I've found that it actually enhances stability on hikes.
review.name: Game-Changer for Secure Hiking

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I ordered 4 different pairs of waterproof shoes.  This pair was longer than the other 8 1/2's, and the most narrow.  I didn't keep them.
review.name: Long and narrow
comment: Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us, we will be sure to pass this information to the appropriate teams for future improvement.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Have worn a couple times and they're not bad. Was expecting more padding and a bit more comfort on hikes. Also, I'd recommend going down half a size, they're a little big.
review.name: Comfortable but Not True to Size

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I bought these for traveling in Rome. Absolutely worth it! Grip on steep hills, grip on wet slippery surfaces, and comfort for walking on uneven roads. These shoes did the job!
review.name: Great shoe!

review.reviewBody: Great shoe, comfortable, cute, goes with everything
review.name: So comfortable

name: Facet 75 Outdry Hiking Shoe - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Republic R Knit Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Like this model for the summer! Light, well ventilated and also has a stiff sole.
review.name: Great shoes at good discount

review.itemreviewed: Republic R Knit Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I've had mine for a couple of seasons now. They've worn well, I ride at least 3 days a week. I think they fit a bit small. I'm a US 10 mens. I usually wear a 43 in euro sizes, I needed a 45 in this particular shoe. Shoes are very comfortable and look good. My feet are on the narrow side, I'm not sure these will work if you have wide feet. I have the blue ones and I like the more subdued look rather than some dayglo color. They also give decent walking ability for instance when you hop off the bike for a lunch stop, or having to portage the bike if I need to on a gravel ride. Overall highly recommended. I did buy mine at a local shop, but being that I've had great experiences with my purchases from Competitive Cyclist, and these being great shoes I'm leaving this review.
review.name: Great Shoes

name: Republic R Knit Cycling Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: For reference I have medium intermediate oval head 58cm which i imagine many people do. The Glendale looked way too big on my face.  Have owned the S3 and while I can just barely pull them off because they are so large and wide they have gaps at the sides which let wind in while riding. Purchased the Slendales and wow they are extremely light weight, comfortable and fit perfectly. They look a lot like the S3 but fit the contours of my face much better and don’t let as much wind in behind the lenses and into my eyes. Will likely get an additional pair in a different color i like them that much.
review.name: Perfect fit for normal sized faces

review.reviewBody: Loving the size of the Slendale's!  They're a scaled down version of the Glendale and offer great coverage and are super light.  The Slendale is my go-to for running while the Glendale has been great for riding and ski touring.
review.name: Great fit and coverage!

review.reviewBody: Unfortunately I am a short person and as such these pants have a long crotch depth and rise is very long and the size I got fit in waist but above my belly button. The length was also way longer than 31-32. More like 34-36. I wear a 30 and would have had  to shorten these by 3-5 inches to fit. I thinkade for taller people with longer rise and inseams. I loved them and the quality but had to return them.
review.name: Great pants but fit is odd.

review.reviewBody: By far the worst technical piece I have ever bought from an outdoor company. Absolutely zero thought put into the making of this piece. Definitely a red flag to anything they make. I have worn them biking, and hiking they worked to keep you very dry and super lightweight. The fit and maneuver ability is not so great
review.name: Gore-Tex pants

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] A decent rain pant.  After about 3 hours of continuous steady rain the pant does seem to give into to the saturation and ya do start to get damp - but similar to most rain gear I suspect
review.name: Rain

review.reviewBody: nice materials, quality construction, impractical...I have not had these pants for very long, therefore I cannot speak to their durablility or use in various rain conditions. Initially, these pants seem to be made from quality materials and the construction is very good. They have kept the water our so far. These pants, however, are very slim and fitted. You cannot slip them on or off while wearing boots.If you want to slip them on - you have to take your boots off. If you want to slip them off, you have to take your boots off. This makes them highly impractical for various types of rainy days.
review.name: Men's GORE-TEX®Minimalist Pant
comment: Hi, thank you for posting your review. We are sorry to hear that our product is not as you expected. We're committed to making sure to turn your experience around to a rather delightful one. If you require our assistance, please contact us using our Contact Us form on the following website: https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat so we can help you further. We’re available Mon.-Fri. 9AM - 5PM EST. Thank you!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great pants that seem to be very well made.  Unfortunately, the small fits my waist perfectly, but my hips are way too tight.  The medium fits perfectly everywhere except in the waist.  A simple drawstring would have made these pants a 5 star product.  Without a drawstring, these pants became useless and had to be returned.
review.name: Why no drawstring?
comment:
Thank you for providing us with a feedback on our products. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention.
I am very sorry to hear that the item has not met your expectations.

We will make sure to forward your idea and feedback to an appropriate department, so that we may think about an appropriate solution for the future. Thank you so much for sharing your opinion with us.

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST

Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody:
Not sure how to use them? Are pants suppose to go under them?  if so shorts or really supper thin ultra light hiking pants.Not as generous as the picture. I understand there "minimalist" meant for backpacking but would of like to have a bit more leg room and perhaps a wider hip so you can put them over pants .
   The mens Med jacket has room but  the pants fall short 0r should i say tight .Use then for all four season.Hopeful they will work for winter sports with just a basis layer under neath .
review.name: too small

review.reviewBody:
Took these on a trip around the Colorado four pass loop. As is typical, we got caught in an afternoon storm at 10,000 feet and suited up. Pants kept us dry from the rain and wete sufficiently breathable for 2 hours of rainy hiking. They are definitely pants to put on BEFORE it rains because the ankle zips don't accommodate footwear too well. But I knew that going in. Zippers are fail points for waters so we elected to minimize the water ingress points. 

Tl;dr kept us dry. Breathed well for intense, medium duration active wear
review.name: Did the job

review.reviewBody: They looked like nice rain pants. Unfortunately they didn't fit because there is not way to adjust or tighten the waist so I returned them.
review.name: Nice but no waist adjustment

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] A nice simple rain pant. Has the features you need and leaves out the ones that you don't. These consistently kept me dry and stood up to a good amount of abuse.
review.name: Great Rainpant

review.reviewBody: The pants fit great, looks great and are waterproof for the most part with one critical fail point. The pocket zipper does not hold water out and channels it down the outside of the leg and onto pants below. Everywhere else held up great but unless your top rain coat/shell covers your pants pockets then water will enter at this point. For reference I was out in continuous but not heavy rain for 20 mins and was wet on both outside legs down to the knees on pants under the minimalist pants as water leaked in.
review.name: One main downfall

name: Minimalist Pant - Men's

hasVariant.name: Freestone Z Bootfoot - Rubber - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Simms Freestone Z Bootfoot - Rubber - Men's online or shop all Fishing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Ordered size 9 my normal size and they fit perfect. After I put them on the first time I could tell they would be hard to take off. First half dozen times I wore them I put a plastic shopping bag over each foot to make it easier to get them off. They have since loosened up alittle so no more shopping bags. So far great boots. Small interior pocket would have been nice.
review.name: Good fit

review.reviewBody: These are my first new pair of waders in 22 years. They are made very well. The boot fits true to size , nice ankle support. My only complaint is that they are alittle hard getting off. The ankle area is alittle tight , I hope they loosen up with use.
review.name: Very nice waders.

review.reviewBody: Bought them for my son who wears a size 8. He loves 5hem and says they fit perfectly. As all Simms products, they are well made.
review.name: Excellent quality

review.reviewBody: The plain earth color seems to blend well with multiple habitats in multiple seasons in S. Louisiana. The boots are insulated enough that my feet were comfortable during my first hunt in sub freezing temps. The uninsulated upper is perfect as I can wear them during early teal or frogging season as they seem to breath well. I'm 5'10", 190lbs (32" waist) and wear 10.5-11 in shoes. The waders fit perfect. Zip chest and hand pockets are nice additions.
review.name: Great for S. Louisiana and cheaper than most competitors.

review.reviewBody: I had been waiting and watching reviews on these waders for the last few months before pulling the trigger on them. After hunting in them over the last few weeks in several different places, they have impressed me. The fit is perfect. I hunt 30-40 times a season, so these will be put to the test over the remainder of this season and next. Only thing I’ve found missing is D- loops. But I made my own using a ziiptie and it’s worked fine. I think these will contend with the likes of Chene and Sitka. And the warranty looks to be the same if not better.
review.name: So far so good!

review.reviewBody: performance is great. keep me warm in the winter. but one of the seems on shoulder strap os coming loose.

the uppers fit very well and are very comfortable! But the boot foot is tight.  I've worn the Simms Extreme boot foot waders for years and a size 12 boot [ 11 shoe size] was roomy and fit well with a thicker winter sock.   This new boot is smaller, so I am returning them for a 13 that will hopefully allow a bit more room.  Generally, a very nice wader with excellent features
review.name: Good Value

review.reviewBody: These are like sitka or KUIU but a fraction of the price. I have only hunted in them twice but overall I really like them so far.
review.name: Thumbs up

review.reviewBody: These bootfoots make winter wading so much WARMER, wish I'd made the switch earlier.  There is a bit of warm air that doesn't get compressed or squeezed out by general water pressure, unlike your typical stockingfoots.  And the convenience of the zipper speaks for itself.  So you stay much more comfortable and can enjoy spey fishing longer in places like my winter favorite, the Mo!
review.name: Great Solution to Cold Winter Wading

review.reviewBody: Bought these waders for fishing and duck hunting as I didn’t feel it necessary to own 2 separate waders for each occasion. Very comfortable, lightweight, easy to slip on with the zip and love the color for hunting purposes. So far they are holding up well and possess a great value for the price. The only thing I would like to possibly see would be a little more cushion and abrasive resistance in the knee area in the event you are kneeling down or something. Keep it up Simms
review.name: Great product.

name: Freestone Z Bootfoot - Rubber - Men's

hasVariant.name: Camp Kitchen Folding Spatula
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Camp Kitchen Folding Spatula online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I’ve had the msr nylon cooking utensils for 15 years and thought it was time to work in some new equipment. I brought it along for an overnight paddling trip to make scrambled eggs. The spatula works fine. The only down side is it doesn’t hold tight in its extended position when in use. There’s a lot of give and bend as you use it. My concern is the locking mechanism will snap before long.
review.name: Adequate not great

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This spatula is very cute. It's lightweight and packs on my bike well. Always a crowd favorite when I whip it out for breakfast!
review.name: Cuuuute

review.reviewBody: I gave up on folding/camp utensils years ago. They were always too big, bulky, or just flimsy. I like Sea to Summit gear so I decided to give this a try. I made pancakes tonight to test this thing out. The mechanism they have developed to bridge the fold and make the utensil usable makes this the most solid spatula I have ever seen. i couldn't tell I was using a camping tool AT ALL. Additionally, this thing folds down extremely flat, more flat than I thought it would be. As I get ready for a year long bicycle tour, I am very glad this is in my pack. I just wish I'd bought the spoon too.
review.name: Finally! A SOLID kitchen tool that packs small!

name: Camp Kitchen Folding Spatula

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great fall weight socks to keep your angles warm but not have to have heavier socks on. Nice and cushy.
review.name: I will buy this product again.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I'm a large (size 10) in every brand, but saw that I'm a medium (size 9-10.5) in this product. When I got them they were REALLY snug. Seemed like I should size up?? Hopefully they stretch out??
review.name: Something is up with the sizing

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I purchased the Merino Hike light Mini socks for summer wear. Perfect fit. Order arrived pro9mptly, several days before expect delivery. I would buy the socks again.
review.name: yes

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] 3 years ago, I went on a mission to find the perfect sock, purchasing many different brands and styles. over a full year of trial and error i found these the perfect Sock from icebreaker. So, I bought 10 pairs of the Hike+ Lightweight sock, 5 pairs of the Medium, and 5 pairs of the heavy weight sock. I ended up wearing the lightweight socks almost all year long, only switching to the thicker socks during the coldest part of the year. and with that the lightweight socks lasted about 2 years before developing holes at the big toe, but that may be due to an ill-fitting pair of boots. I can't say enough good things about these socks, they keep foot odder and blisters away after hiking all day. and keep my feet warm in the winter. the Fit is perfect and there are no seems or stitching that rub. Get yourself a pair and give them a try, you will not regret it.
review.name: I found my Forever Sock.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I am really enjoying the socks, they have become thinner over the years. I have been wearing this same brand, and same style sock for the better part of the last decade. I am a car mechanic that is on my feet all day long most of the time. I have noticed that the cushioning of the sock has diminished over the last few years. They are still a great sock that allow my feet to breathe all the day long.
review.name: This is the third batch of these in two years.

name: Hike+ Light Mini Sock

description: Buy the Stoic Groundwork Single Sleeping Bag - 0 Degree Synthetic online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Groundwork Single Sleeping Bag - 0 Degree Synthetic
hasVariant.description: Buy the Stoic Groundwork Single Sleeping Bag - 0 Degree Synthetic online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Groundwork Single Sleeping Bag - 0 Degree Synthetic
review.reviewBody: Good bag for this price. It is very warm and comfortable. I slept through 30-35 degrees F, woke up to light frost on my car, but was completely comfortable and warm in the bag, never noticed the outside temperature. I purchased the bag with intention of sleeping in temps in 20-30 degrees F this fall which I haven't had the chance to test, but I feel confident it will keep me warm based on the previous experiences. I am 6'1, 200lb, am a side sleeper that moves a lot and don't really like mummy bag shape, but I do have enough room in this bag to move around and stay comfortable. The only real problem I've had with this bag, is the zipper. It seems lower quality compared to the other materials the bag is made with, and it catches the bag a lot when zipping up. There is a tube of insulation that runs along the length of the zipper seam which is great when you're in and all zipped up, but it is finicky to get zipped up. I've used bags with nicer, bigger zippers that zip up and down much more easily than this one. Be patient and deliberate with this zipper if you want it to last. Aside from that, I am totally satisfied and warm in this sleeping bag, glad to have it in my lineup and it did not break the bank in the least.
review.name: Great value

review.itemreviewed: Groundwork Single Sleeping Bag - 0 Degree Synthetic
review.reviewBody: Although this bag would not be ideal for backpacking if you are close to your vehicle and don’t have have far to go for camping this STOIC bag is perfect. So perfect I even bought one for my friend for her bday! The quality is very nice and keeps you extremely warm throughout the night. The bag is roomy enough for myself and my dog to sleep comfortably in it. I prefer sleeping on my side and it is still comfortable to do so in this bag.
review.name: Great winter sleeping bag!

review.itemreviewed: Groundwork Single Sleeping Bag - 0 Degree Synthetic
review.reviewBody:
My heat went out when it was -40°f outside. It was 4am so I pulled out my sleeping bag and went back to sleep. My phone froze and died, and all the water in my cabin froze— coffee machine, dish basin, greywater bucket, etc. Indoors it was approximately 8° but I was very comfortable inside the bag. I woke up to my landlady bursting through my door in because she thought I had frozen to death in there. In fact my dog and I were just soundly asleep in this sleeping bag. Highly recommend since I didn’t die. 

I also used this to camp from NC to AK and temps ranged from about 5°f to 80°f or so. Bag is great for all seasons but gets a little too warm around 60°.

Only complaint is that the zipper gets stuck frequently and I did pee my pants one time because I was stuck inside trying to get out to use the restroom so I took off one star
review.name: Neighbor thought I froze & died in -40°

review.itemreviewed: Groundwork Single Sleeping Bag - 0 Degree Synthetic
review.reviewBody:
Big fan of the stoic bags. This is a reliable and high-quality sleeping bag that has proven its worth in some super cold conditions. It's exceptionally warm and comfortable and I have had no issues with the zipper. I have no hesitation in recommending this sleeping bag to fellow adventurers who need a dependable companion for cold-weather trips. 

At the price it makes sense to grab it as an extra for friends.
review.name: Amazing bag!

name: Groundwork Single Sleeping Bag - 0 Degree Synthetic

review.itemreviewed: PCS-10.3 Deluxe Home Mechanic Repair Stand
review.reviewBody: This is a perfect workstand for a home mechanic. It's sturdy, stable, & relatively lightweight. It's easy to setup & store away after use. There is a Park Tool video on YouTube, it makes assembly very simple. My only complaint would be the small tool tray. It's good for a handful of smaller Allen wrenches, or small bolts. At least a bin that is a few inches deep would have been nice.

review.itemreviewed: PCS-10.3 Deluxe Home Mechanic Repair Stand
review.reviewBody: There are a lot of work stands out there but don't be fooled by some of the lower priced stands, they are nothing like a Park Tools stand,  sturdy, well made and great looking, yes they are more expensive but well worth it, you won't be disappointed!

review.itemreviewed: PCS-10.3 Deluxe Home Mechanic Repair Stand
review.reviewBody: I had an old cheap stand that I used for several years it took me about 30 minutes to put this one together and this thing is incredible.  Seems like it could almost hold a motorcycle it's so sturdy everything fit together perfectly and it's extremely well crafted no way could I go back to a junky old stand.  Also comes with a tool holder.   =M<°=M<°=M<°=M<°=M<°

review.reviewBody: Wore it on one short road ride and my neck hurt for a week. Maybe works better for a more upright commuter. I returned the helmet
review.name: Heavy…

review.reviewBody: Very peppy emails after order giving the impression you're part of the Back Country family. "We have received your order..' , We have printed shipping labels', We've shipped the order! Here's your tracking #'.  'Your package should arrive on Wednesday..'. Nope, didn't arrive. I check the tracking info and it's only updated till Monday, yet still says delivery on Wednesday. Would've been really nice to have it for the ride I planned for Thursday. I'm sure it'll be here in a few days, I'm sure it's going to be 5 star worthy, but if I can't get it when I needed it, can't get accurate shipment information, why would I buy from Back Country if other vendors, Amazon, are available?
review.name: Where is it?
comment: We are so very sorry for the shipping estimated arrival notification issue, we've emailed you to see if we can help resolve this.

review.reviewBody: Good helmet. Fits well, magnetic latch is great. My only complaint is battery life. I seem to get about 80 to 90 minutes per charge which is not quite enough to get back-and-forth to work.

review.reviewBody:
I recently acquired a new hat, and I can't help but rave about how awesome it is! From the moment I put it on, it instantly elevated my outfit and mood. The design is stylish yet versatile, making it perfect for any occasion—whether I’m running errands, heading to a casual gathering, or just enjoying a sunny day outdoors.

The material is incredibly comfortable, providing both breathability and warmth, depending on the weather. Plus, the fit is just right—no awkward pinching or slipping off my head. It feels like it was made just for me! 

What I love most about this hat is its unique flair. It stands out in a crowd without being over the top, allowing me to express my personality effortlessly. I've received countless compliments, and it has quickly become my go-to accessory.

In summary, this hat is more than just a piece of clothing; it's a statement. If you're looking to add a touch of style to your wardrobe, I highly recommend getting your hands on one of these fabulous hats. You won't regret it!
review.name: Best hat ever

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Some other reviewers were talking about a too tight opening, insole pain, tongue sliding down.
First time I put them on, I experienced the same things however, with a little adjusting...open the mouth of the shoe wide, wear the correct socks (I wear a medium thickness sock with these) pull the tongue and don't 'tie' the shoe too tightly and all of these went away. A really comfortable shoe.
Nothing is perfect so no 5. And I will return to see how long they last and to see if my plantar fasciitis flares after wearing them for awhile. Otherwise, I really like them!
review.name: Just purchased. Will return with an update

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I’ve been wearing Solomon winter sneakers for several years and am never disappointed. Good structure.
review.name: Great Winter Sneakers

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Bought these for my wife and she says these are great shoes. They provide great stability and traction on different surfaces. The only complaint I would have is that the mesh screen allows for sand to fill up the shoes and get into that toe area.
review.name: Great shoe

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Good grip on the ground, high top or mid top will be better.
review.name: Good grip!

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I've used these every day for months and I love how comfortable, light, and waterproof they are. Great fit, grip, and design.
review.name: Hiking, running, farm shoes! All in one

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Overall I liked these shoes but will buy a different model from Salomon next. The tongue constantly slides to the side which is frustrating. Otherwise, the shoes have been great. The waterproofing is legit but they are still breathable.
review.name: Tongue needs improved

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love these shoes, comfortable and great stability.
review.name: Great hikers

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Comfortable right out of the box. Used mainly for hiking on a variety of terrain. This is my 4th pair. The tread does wear down quicker than I’d like. Once the tread is low I use as a street shoe. I am a big fan of the quick lace system.
review.name: Light weight comfortable

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Decent hiking shoe. I have been a diehard Salomon fan until they changed their footprint. I bought the 8.5 recently to bring on an extended trip as an alternative to packing bulky (but awesome) Salomon boots. Note - I only had Salomon athletic footwear until they changed their sizing and lost the real-person’s toe box. They’ve worked out ok but, after wearing for several east coast hikes, I wish I would have shopped around more.
review.name: Missing the old Salomons
comment: Hey, thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us. We often adjust our products based on direct customer feedback. We will make sure to pass this along to our designers for consideration in future products.

review.itemreviewed: X Ultra 4 GTX Hiking Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: These are the best, most supportive, and good-looking shoes I’ve ever worn. I highly recommend for all seniors, hikers and dog walkers. I have 3 other pairs in different colors.
review.name: The Best

review.reviewBody: I like the quality, I like the colors, but the shoulders are too tight and the sleeves are too short for me. I normally wear a medium, I saw it runs small so I decided to get the large. I still find the shoulders too tight if I do any sort of movement. So overall, I am disappointed with the sizing.
review.name: Great Quality, Feels Small

review.reviewBody: Got 2 flannel shirts for my son he loves them. Very comfortable and warm. Excellent
review.name: Well made

review.reviewBody: Love the medium weight and unique color choices but the shoulder area is somewhat restrictive when arms are out in front (ie on steering wheel)
review.name: Tight shoulder configuration

review.reviewBody: Fits well. Plaid pattern classic and colors are rich. Reasonably priced. I’m happy.
review.name: Worn twice and complimented both times.

review.reviewBody:
I'm probably pretty average sized though a little fuller in the belly as I age.  This shirt, in a size Large, fits me pretty well. Its super soft and fairly thick. Definitely a cold weather shirt.  I think it could be a smidge longer and the fit around the wrists could be a bit looser for comfort.

I've only worn it one day so far so not sure how well it will hold up and I'm afraid to dry it in the dryer for fear it will shrink and be unwearable.
review.name: Super Soft; kind of tight at wrists

review.reviewBody: I love this flannel shirt! I’m not sure why other reviewers are complaining about the fit. I’m a tall skinny/athletic build and they fit me great. If you are usually between sizes maybe go with the bigger size? I’m a medium tall or large, tried on both M and L and ultimately kept the L. Overall the shirt is warm, has a great cut/fit and looks very stylish. Would definitely buy again.
review.name: Favorite Flannel

review.reviewBody: I washed it once and now the sleeves are too short. I really like the color and the weight… too bad.
review.name: Sleeves are too short

review.reviewBody: This shirt fits weird. I usually wear a large and have average muscular arms. This shirt is super tight in the upper arm area. Most often that would be flattering but its actually suffocatingly tight. The torso area is a little snug but would have been doable if the arms weren't so restrictive. Returning for sure.
review.name: Odd fit

review.reviewBody: At 5'11" and 175 pounds, I wear a medium in this flannel, and the fit is perfect. It’s true to size with enough room for layering without feeling bulky. The warmth is ideal for cooler days, and the material is both soft and durable. I love the attention to detail, especially the sturdy buttons that complement the overall design. Highly recommend for anyone looking for a comfortable, well-fitting flannel!
review.name: Great fit! Warm!

name: Venture Classic Flannel Shirt - Men's

review.reviewBody: Bought this saddle back in March 2022. I’ve put about 1000 miles on it since then. At first, it was very comfortable, but after about 5-6 rides I started getting pain in my inner left thigh. I made various adjustments over the next few weeks trying to get it dialed in, but to no avail. More recently I’ve developed left foot numbness to go along with the thigh pain. I’ve been riding for about 25 years -mountain and road - and both issues are post-new saddle pain points. Going to order  something else & hope for the best.
review.name: Nice saddle,

review.reviewBody: I returned these to exchange for a smaller size because they are huge compared other company sizing. I has been almost a month since I sent them back and I'm still waiting for the new size or any sort of communication. I have reached out to customer service and confirmed that they received my return but have had no additional updates. I wouldn't recommend purchasing from UGG - the quality is good but the customer service and the exchange/return process is very timely. By the time I get my exchange my child will have outgrown the size I exchanged for.
review.name: Still waiting on an exchange.....

review.reviewBody: Love this jacket.  Full disclosure, I haven't tested in in cold weather yet, but it seems like it will be typically warm like today's down jackets.  I love the color -- it's a little less "orange" than the photo (maybe that's my monitor!)  I like to wear lots of layers in the winter, and tend to get bulky, so I went with a size M.  I always size up for jackets.  I'm 5'3+, 127 lbs.  Athletic build.  This fits great and has plenty of room for a sweater or hoodie underneath.  The M falls just below my hip (I have a very short torso and long legs) a little lower that the model in the photo.  The features on this include a zippered breast pocket, two zippered side pockets and in inside slip-in pocket.  Yu can sinch the bottom to keep the wind out.  It's very packable and light weight.  I think this is going to be my new go-to jacket and will be very versatile.
review.name: New Go-to Jacket

review.reviewBody: I bought this jacket a few weeks ago and have been wearing it nonstop. I normally wear a small/medium, but I bought this in XS because it was the only size, and it fits great. I do like a snug fit though, because I wear it under my shell on cold snowboarding days. I haven’t washed it yet so I can’t say how it’ll hold up, but so far so good. I love the color too.
review.name: Great jacket

review.reviewBody: I wanted to like this jacket and it just didn’t work. I’m 4’11 and was swimming in the XS. I expected it might be long. Or being a petite. And, overall the cut wasn’t flattering and it was much too big. It felt really warm and the quality looked great. It just didn’t fit right.
review.name: Awkward fit

review.reviewBody: I returned this jacket. The newer version has no insulation in the shoulders. My older version is the best coat I’ve own -warm and easy to move in but my zipper finally went.
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody: Bought this to replace my 4 year old stretchdown jacket. The fit is true to size. However, the amount of fill in this jacket leaves a lot to be desired... it is very thin. The fabric, liner, and zipper all feel and sound much cheaper than my old stretchdown. Unfortunately, I'll be returning and looking elsewhere.
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody: This jacket is so warm and light, plus it looks great! It packs down really well.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: Like all other Mountain Hardware products I have owned, the quality and finishes superb. Be aware of the cut is a little longer at the hip than I anticipated, but it is still very comfortable.
review.name: Roomy And A Great Value

review.reviewBody: Bought for a trip to Banff.  Was lightweight and warm, very easy to pack.  Very happy with my purchase!
review.name: Warm Packable Coat

review.reviewBody: Love this jacket! Such a great matte color and nice and cozy. I love mountain hardwares garment designs. I often find they are more creative and innovative compared to other outdoor brands. I hate their logo though... and for this one it's shellacked on there so you can't rip it off with a seam ripper.
review.name: Love it

review.reviewBody: I used the size chart. I’m 5ft 4” and about 104 pounds with a 34B  bust.  I bought the small as suggested but had to return it because it was too big.  The XS fits me even with layers underneath. The cut is fairly wide in the hips even in the XS.  If you have a boyish figure like me you might find the Patagonia down sweater fits you better.
review.name: Runs big

name: Stretchdown Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I bought this product about 2 years ago.  I do a lot of wildlife photography and the hands-free nature of this boat is perfect for holding the boat steady to get the perfect shot.

I've also done numerous overnight remote camping trips out of this boat.  The tankwell in the back easily fits a large hardsided waterproof tub, and the compartment up front can fit my 3 person tent (in a drybag) along with another large dry bag with all my clothing.  I've actually found that this boat is better than camping out of a canoe which is something I never thought I'd ever say about a kayak.

The speed of this boat is 3 mph (you can go slower but you can't go faster, the hull speed essentially limits you).  I really am wondering what the speed of the 12' version is because although I don't need the extra space (or weight) I'd be willing to trade up just for the added speed.

The biggest drawback of the boat is the propeller, the unit itself is fantastic and I've had no mechanical issues at all.  The issue is that fundamentally, weeds, reeds, seaweed, etc all love to wrap themselves up in the propeller requiring a lot of bending over and pulling it out of the water to rip all that junk of of the propeller.  It's sort of binary, you're either in that type of water and you want to tear your hair out or you aren't.  I've had to resort to paddling on many occasions, and given the heavy barge like nature of this boat, that ain't fun.

The stability of this boat is also amazing, it's so stable that waves crash against it.  I had to go buy some waterproof rain pants because the boat doesn't budge in even 2 foot white caps and the water just crashes onto the deck.  People look at me like I'm crazy when I go out into Boston harbor but I've never felt safer in a boat.
review.name: Great for more than just fishing

review.reviewBody: i have been looking for a pedal kayak for about a year and saving up, red all the reviews and came to old town, always new about there canoes, and new they where the best and since i am from wisconsin. This kayak quickly moved to the top of my list.  Had it out on a salt water fishing trip on the indian river, by sebastion inlet, was able to work the mangroves, wonderfully, the yak controls like a dream. Moves along nicely, with minimal effort.
review.name: great for fishing

review.reviewBody: I’ve only taken it out twice, but this kayak may be the greatest engineering feat since the invention of the wheel. The pedal drive is smooth in both forward and reverse. With fairly minimal pedaling effort, the Topwater moves at a decent pace. It’s also very stable. I’m average size (6’1” 210 lbs), and it is the first kayak I’ve been able to stand in without worrying about falling in.
review.name: Topwater PDL

name: Topwater PDL Kayak

hasVariant.description: Buy the Mammut Nordwand Pro HS Hooded Jacket - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Nordwand Pro HS Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I have used the jacket for the last 5 months excessively and it's still not showing any signs of wear. Burly material, great abrasion resistance and holding up to rock, ice, picks of ice tools, etc.
The snow skirt is nice for deep snow and backcountry skiing but the last real proof of the jacket was during the climb of Mont Blanc in howling winds - it kept me dry, warm and safe and gave me an enjoyable climb despite the conditions.
It's not the lightest or most compressible due to the thick Gore-Tex pro fabric but it is worth it when the weather demands the best!
review.name: Bomber Mountain Protection

review.itemreviewed: Nordwand Pro HS Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Like the jacket. Bought a man's XL in the nighttime color that I thought looked black. The material is stiff and will likely hold up to abrasions. Sleeves are long and the cuffs are deep with wide Velcro. There are plenty of external and internal pockets. The jacket fit is slim compared to most companies. The Nightime color is actually dark blue and not black, but is a nice color. There are Marmot logos on nearly every side of the jacket, with a larger one in the middle of the back. The main zipper is left handed and not right handed.
review.name: Quality Jacket with Querks

review.itemreviewed: Nordwand Pro HS Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I've taken this jacket downhill skiing, on a winter hike through frozen waterfalls in a valley, and on multi pitch ice climbs, and it performed perfectly across the board. The velcro sleeve straps work perfect, the pit-zips are essential and are big enough to really cool off when you need it, it's SUPER durable (I've already taken a fall or two in it). During the one climb, it started pouring rain, and by the time we rapped down, it had rained so hard that a decent portion of the ice was gone, and I stayed BONE DRY. The hood fit's perfectly with and without a helmet (somehow). 

My only two complaints (and they''re minor at best) are 1: that the pit zips are a bit difficult to re-zip while wearing the jacket, but that's a bit of a testament to their durability, as I feel you need to sacrifice some easy with durability. and 2: The size seems to be a little bit bigger than the rest of the Mammut products that I own. It's not the end of the world for me, as it leaves room for more layers underneath, if need be. I got the XXL as I'm about 6'3", and between 230-240 (not much extra padding). I can't expect every article of clothing to fit like a tailored suit to a guy with a build like an NFL player, but it's a bit wide around the mid section. You can adjust this with your harness, the pull strings and the other features, so again, this is more of a nitpick than anything else. Other than the fact that it wasn't tailored to fit people with the build of an NFL player and the pit zips are too durable to easily zip up while wearing, I'd say this is legitimately the perfect all mountain/alpine hardshell (in my limited experience). I cannot recommend this enough. It's great! I'm a HUGE HUGE fan of this jacket.
review.name: pretty much perfect in every way

review.itemreviewed: Nordwand Pro HS Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is a superb ski jacket. I wore it skiing and stayed dry. I had as many pockets as I needed and despite the snow fall, stayed warm and dry.
review.name: Well worth it

review.itemreviewed: Nordwand Pro HS Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I love this jacket so much and highly recommend it. This is a nice upgrade over the Haldigrat HS (forced to replace after that jacket was stolen), thanks largely to the stretchy back material and better internal pockets. 

If you are familiar with Mammut sizing, this jacket fits as expected. I struggle with the Mammut performance fit as my torso and arm length fit Medium perfectly, but my shoulders and chest fit Large perfectly. 

I am 6'0", 180lb (endurance athlete but I also rep 225 on bench); My Haldigrat (size Large) was too long and bunched up, this (size Medium) fits perfectly but is a little snug when reaching my arms forward. I can still fit a base layer and medium-thickness down jacket (Mammut Broad Peak IN Hooded Jacket) underneath comfortably.

If you're close to my description and are struggling between medium or large, I'm happier with Medium, fwiw.
review.name: American sizing review

review.itemreviewed: Nordwand Pro HS Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: Material is softer and more packable than the 2020 Nordwand Advanced HS.  I'm 6'0" 185lbs. Large is perfect to layer over puffy and mid layers. Not too bulky to wear as a single layer with no mid layer.  Vented under arms and enough pockets on interior and exterior to effectively manage backcountry or resort needs. Not ideal if you need packable layer to consume small volume. The Goretex Pro material will not pack tight and compact like lighter weight membrane.  If a bomb proof and fully featured jacket is what you're looking for this is a suitable option.  I like the tailored for through arms and chest. I have not used in technical situations yet, but the tailoring gives me confidence the jacket will not cause restrictions.
review.name: Fully equipped outer layer

review.itemreviewed: Nordwand Pro HS Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
This is the best and most versatile hard shell I've ever had. The fit is perfect. It's somehow comfortable both as a shell while wearing a tee shirt on a rainy 55¬∞ day, and with a puffy and base layer under it while sauntering through the woods or doing a bit of backcountry snowboarding. 

While I do climb some, I'm no alpine climber. I got this because I want the range of motion and comfort while being in the back country.  Knowing this is made for the deep backcountry alpine climber, I figured it would be up to whatever mountain I would try. 

10/10, would recommend.
review.name: Top of the top of the line hard shell

review.itemreviewed: Nordwand Pro HS Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: I've used it mostly as a rain jacket, and I haven't overheated yet with the armpit vents open. I am so excited to use it this winter. It is so good at temperature control
review.name: Great jacket at a great deal

review.itemreviewed: Nordwand Pro HS Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody: In the category of shells, it doesn't get any better! You will not be disappointed. Among the many features, there's a properly sized under-arm zippered vent!!! Clearly alot of design thought and testing has gone into this shell.

review.itemreviewed: Nordwand Pro HS Hooded Jacket - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Love love love this jacket! I'm highly visible, which makes it easy for my group to see me, especially if I go into the trees. Additionally the pockets are super bomber! I'm able to access everything except for the chest strap without finagling around. The chest pocket sits right over my chest strap, but that's OK.

Occasionally I mistake my pit zip pockets for the side pockets when I'm trying to open pockets, but that only happens when I'm wearing goggles and thick gloves, since goggles obstruct my view when looking down and gloves affect my proprioception. With pit zips... they're a little hard to unzip all the way unless you grab the sleeve, but having dual zippers make this easier as I can position the zippers in a way that makes it easy to open.

I've read reviews that said that the mesh pockets are too small for climbing skins; I haven't had this issue. I do roll up my skins (and they get a little bulky) so that they they are stashable inside the mesh pockets.

I love the wind protection on this! I ski in the rockies with weather around 15 degrees F, and I can ski in a base layer with this jacket. When there are high winds (30+ MPH), I feel unaffected!

name: Nordwand Pro HS Hooded Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: Classic greatness. Changed the laces to my kid’s (7 yo boy) favorite color, and now he thinks they’re the best boots ever.
review.name: Love

review.reviewBody: Love these boots!! The quality is absolutely outstanding and my teen with tiny feet loves how "cool" they look. She also feels very sturdy in them. Totally worth the price.
review.name: Amazing quality, worth the price

review.reviewBody: Quality, sturdy boots that will last.  Got this for my daughter, but I plan on having my other children (son included) use it when she grows out (they grow in) of it.  I have the adult version boot and thats why I got this boot for my child because I know it's quality, it will work well, keep their feet warm and dry, and it will last.
review.name: Quality

review.reviewBody: Bought these for my son,  so far no complaints from him . He's worn them probably 10 times for various activities,  shoveling snow, sliding & Snow mobiling with friends.  When I ask him how they worked, his reply is always feet warm and dry.
review.name: He says there great

review.reviewBody: These boots are incredibly warm, waterproof and durable. This is the second size we have purchased for our son because we are so pleased with them. Excellent for winter hiking and snowshoeing, too. I anticipate purchasing the next size up as foot continues to grow!
review.name: Happy feet!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Warm, comfortable and great in the snow & walking the dog!
review.name: My boy loves it!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Great boots for kids. This is our fifth pair of the same boot. The kids keep growing but they always want the same pair of Sorel boots from last year. They’re warm, waterproof and look great.
review.name: Great boots for kids.

review.reviewBody: I got this boot for myself, I am around 5 ft and 100 lbs and normally wear a kids 3. I ordered the 3 and it does fit, but it’s a bit snug. Especially when I wear thick socks for the snow. In comparison I also got the kids size 4 to see if they were better. The 4’s were unfortunately too big even with extra thick socks. I’m sticking with the 3’s and hoping they will stretch out as I wear them more. I’m very pleased about the quality of the boots! They are heavy duty and sturdy. I feel like they’ll hold up well in the snow. Plus they look cute.
review.name: Great quality boot but run small

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love these boots for my son. He said they’re comfortable and keep his feet warm. Our sorels always cycle through 2 children and usually last 4 years and still look awesome!
review.name: Best boots for kids

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These boots have been worn by a small footed adult for 2 winters now. They are super durable and keep feet cozy in New England winter weather. I purchased these to wear during a daily 30 min (each way) walking commute to work in snow and ice. They are great - they are the only shoes I feel confident in wearing while walking on black ice. But, they are a bit overkill on days where it's cold but no new snow has fallen because of how heavy they are. While I would buy these again, I would also buy slightly lighter weight Sorels to get me through 40 degree weather days and save these for the super cold, snowy and icy days. These are definitely not shoes one could wear all day because of the weight.
review.name: Great for winter (but heavy)

name: Caribou Boot - Kids’

review.itemreviewed: Kaha 2 Frost Moc GTX Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: The Kaha 2 Frost Moc GTX by Hoka had me at first glance. The aesthetics were undeniably fresh—a bold fusion of vintage snow boot charm and modern sneaker vibes. Add in the promise of utilitarian functionality with waterproof Gore-Tex, and I was sold. Unfortunately, the reality fell far short of the promise. Despite being marketed as comfortable, the narrow toebox and unforgivingly stiff insoles were a betrayal to both my feet and my spirit. What should have been a cozy winter companion turned into a source of frustration. Regretfully, they went back to the store.
review.name: Style Over Comfort: My Experience:

name: Kaha 2 Frost Moc GTX Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: As much of a fan of this idea as I still am I just couldn’t stick with it. I wasn’t able to tighten it down enough, nor could I lock my bike tube for security. It also is a shame that this had to be added to the bike attachment making it even taller and more wobbly. This product needs to be an independent piece that can attach to the bar frame and have a lock. If this would happen I would buy the new one and bring the bar out of storage.
review.name: Great idea but missed the mark

review.reviewBody: Bought the 15 mm to allow my new MTB fit my old Thule tray.  Problem was the Fox 36 suspension was significantly wider than the adapter.  This meant the whole bike could shift back and forth around the axle.  So I added some washers to take up the slack.  Maybe Thule could include something like washers or more clever to take up slack?
review.name: How to fix long axle lengths on adapter

review.reviewBody: Someone stole part from Bike rack, I purchased new parts to replace.
review.name: I would buy this if I need it again

review.reviewBody: Easy to install and solid construction but no way to lock the bike to the adapter as with others of this style (e.g., Rocky Mountain)
review.name: Solid Construction But Missing Lock

review.reviewBody: It would be nice if Thule decides to add an adaptable cup upgrade for the existing adapter so that it will accommodate 110mm width boost standards.  It would require a simple change of one or more cups on the spindle.  Include both!
review.name: Well built and simple.

name: Thru-Axle Adapter

review.reviewBody: Added grip on slippery river rocks is a huge improvement. Only had them on for maybe 15 total hrs of wading but they are still securely in place.
review.name: Wish I bought them a long time ago

review.reviewBody: Studs have never failed me. Feel real secure with them on the boots. I would get the tool to put them on with mines didn’t come with it.
review.name: Good looking boot real stable

review.reviewBody: Aluminum works but its soft and copresses
review.name: My choice after 4 decades on B I G Steelhead water

review.reviewBody: Almost sticky on slippery rocks.  Off the charts!!

Put them on my G4 Guide boots  felt and did two weeks fishing average four hours wet wadding a day . Started west and east bitterroot  and The main boulder and finished on the Gallatin just above big sky. They were flush with the felt by the time I was finished. I was hoping they would last longer for the price.  They do work but got the same satisfaction with Goat heads and a lot cheaper.

The studs were exactly what I needed for my new Flyweight boots.  Easy to install with a simple 1/4 inch nut driver.  You might consider including an installation template in the package, but that's just a very minor quibble.  I simply copied the pattern on the sole of my G3 boots.
review.name: Hard Bite studs

name: HardBite Felt Stud - 20-Pack

hasVariant.description: Buy the WHITESPACE 3L Performance Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I'm 5'10" and 160lbs. I usually wear a 32 size pant so I got the size medium thinking that would be about right for me but these pants were a bit too tight. There is a snap button on the waistband along with an adjustable belt which felt nice and secure when standing but as soon as I sat down the button would unsnap. This design could be improved by using a standard button as opposed to the snap button. Besides that the pants looked great and appear to be made well. If they fit you properly then I think they'd be a good deal.
review.name: Sizing issues

review.reviewBody: I was able to wear these pants and jacket on a snowboard trip and I got all the weather elements that week. Super freezing, high winds, snowing, blue skies, etc. The suit performed very well in all conditions. I was never cold or wet. The water doesn't go through. It just sits on the suit. I would say that one day was super cold with high winds, though the wind didn't penetrate the pants or jacket I believe a warmer base layer would help a bit better. I had a base layer but not thick enough for that particular day. The pants are relatively light so if you go in - 15 or -20 just get a warmer base layer and you'll be fine. I wasn't cold but I did feel the chill that day. This isn't valid for the jacked since it has a warmer layer underneath the main jacked.
review.name: Great pants. Recommend

review.reviewBody: I think these are a great pair of pants if you buy them on sale. There’s a couple of things to point out though. They’re not insulated, so bring your own base layer if that’s what you’re looking for. They run small. A size large will accommodate up to a 33” waist and have about a 31” inseam. The waist strap is different, but it quickly grew on me. The pockets are fantastic. Ultimately this is a comfy shell and worth buying, but not at full MSRP.
review.name: A very comfortable shell.

review.reviewBody: They are a great quality shell pant. Just wear thermals under and was warm with plenty of mobility.
review.name: Love the shell

review.reviewBody: Super comfortable and fit very well. They look great too. Thanks Shaun!
review.name: Love the product!

review.reviewBody: This brand is very cool looking, but beyond that I'm not even sure what to say. These pants and the jacket ... yikes.  Very poor quality for this price.  As noted on other reviews the zippers on the jacket are impossible to get to work with bare hands, let alone with gloves on. The quality of the pants... I don't even know what to say.  They are sort of like a light plastic windbreaker with no warmth whatsoever.  Sizing is also a bit bizarre.  I wear a small pant in every other brand, but these were so tiny I couldn't even attempt to put them on.
review.name: Super disappointed

name: 3L Performance Pant - Men's

review.itemreviewed: Maverick Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I had high expectations, I bought them for light outdoor use, but I have only used them in the city, they are quite waterproof and very comfortable, the materials are of good quality, but this is useless if the construction is not good, the toe caps came off in just over two months of non-intensive use, the rubber seems to have expanded and the glue used was horrible
review.name: Poor construction, damaged in two mouths

review.itemreviewed: Maverick Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought these a few months ago thinking they had to be great if they're Scarpas. I'm sad to say that I have not been very happy with them. Within a month both toe protectors had started to separate from the boot, I've now glued them back twice and they're fully separated again. The soles are already noticeably worn as well, very disappointing after only 4 months. They are also really puffy around the ankles which I don't love, meanwhile they offer very little ankle support. Overall really disappointing boots. They are lightweight, comfy, very breathable, and did have good grip before the soles wore down but I'm not sure I care when they're already so worn out after such a short period of time. I bought some used Scarpa Zodiac GTX boots to replace these and they feel like they're from an entirely different world, way better in every way truly.
review.name: Not up to the Scarpa name

review.itemreviewed: Maverick Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: from a brand like scarpa I expected more, unfortunately these boots seem cheaply constructed, made in PRC run of the mill boots stamped with the scarpa logo.
review.name: I expected more

review.itemreviewed: Maverick Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Tested against many. They're actually quite well built and comfy. The odd thing is that the heals are wide and your heals slide to right and left. I fixed with added insoles. The front is tighter. The shoes are definitely better than most including Boze and Merrill. They are about equal to Keen but not as good as Salomon. Hokas beat in comfort but I doubt they last as Long as Scarpas in general.
review.name: Solid and comfy

review.itemreviewed: Maverick Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is my second pair. I wore them all over Ireland and Scotland over the last two years, and was extremely pleased with performance. No leakage issues, comfortable despite 20000 steps per day over three week trip.
review.name: Really comfortable water proof boot

review.itemreviewed: Maverick Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I got this boot a few years ago to lighten the weight on my feet, without going the full trail runner route. The waterproofing has worked for stepping through ankle-deep streams and mud while keeping my feet dry. The traction works well, they're comfortable for many miles at a time, and they've held up well without falling apart.

In response to one of the other reviews: don't get these expecting stiff ankle support. Think of them more like high-top trail runners.
review.name: Light and comfy

review.itemreviewed: Maverick Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Low budget Scarpa boot, even at a discount. Very little ankle support. A soft, mushy feel in general. No better than the average Merrell.
review.name: Sad day for Scarpa

review.itemreviewed: Maverick Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: The boots fit well, according to size, and are very comfortable. Nice and light but still very supportive.  No backpacking, just walking the dog 1 - 2 miles a day.  One month of daily use, still waterproof.  Only minor complaint is that the laces have to be pulled fairly tightly through the top two loops to keep your foot from slipping forward, time will tell how long the loops last before pulling out. So far so good!
review.name: No complaints so far

name: Maverick Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: Great for mixed terrain. Love the grip on dirt and they roll very fast on all surfaces. Only complaint is they tend to wear fast on tarmac but willing to live with it.
review.name: Love these tires

review.reviewBody:
I've ridden the larger Terra Trail version and now the Terra Speed.  In between, i tried a few other types, but i do like these the best.  The Terra Trail is notably faster than the Speed, but depending on your terrain, that may or may not be the best thing.  The Speed has been fantastic on the fast rolling midwest gravel and still has enough knob for some light singletrack.    
Now, to a gripe.  I am replacing one of my Terra Speeds b/c I was having fun running too low of a pressure.  Not a big deal and my fault.  BUT when I ordered the replacement and used the same SKU on Competitive Cyclist, I now get the "E Rated" version of this tire.  What gives?! Even the packaging was the same and it wasn't until i unrolled it that the little yellow plug icon on the sidewall was visible.  Now i have non-matchy matchy tires.  So sad. :-(    It looks like this one is about 30g heavier than the non E rated version.  Not a huge deal, but seriously, the yellow plug icon is painful to look at when I don't even own an Ebike.  Black sharpie is coming out tonight.  
as for large or small, i haven't measured these yet.
review.name: Great Feedback and Fast

review.reviewBody: Laced these to a pair of Zipp 303s on my Cervelo Aspero for California gravel.  Super fast and tough tires.  Im running a 40mm with 50-60psi for gravel 2-4.  Lots of bigs sharp rocks, and some descent jumps with fast descents.  Held up extremely well.  So far 40 miles with no issues.
review.name: Works great actually

review.reviewBody:
I have the 40mm version on my Boone. These tires are light, fast, and grippy on packed dirt roads, and fast on pavement as well. The best thing I can say about them is that you just have a lot of confidence on nearly every surface. They have the feel of a supple tire and they communicate the road/track feel pretty well and in ways that stiffer gravel tires do not. Maybe because of that suppleness or softer tread compound the tread wears down pretty quick when ridden on pavement, but a front-back swap extends the life of the tires. I had no trouble installing these tubeless. 

Neither pro nor con: after about 1000 miles, there were tiny pin prick holes that bled out a microscopic amount of sealant overnight, almost like having little wet spots on the tread of the tire, but which never led to pressure loss, which I thought was weird. 

I have about 1,600 miles on these now, and I will probably be ready for new ones after 2,000 total miles of 65/35 dirt/pavement riding. I will buy them again. 

EDIT: I've tried a few other tire brands since writing this review (the Terra Speeds were hard to find during the pandemic), and none seemed to match up with the Contis. This is the best gravel tire I have used.
review.name: Fast gravel tire

name: Terra Speed Tire - Tubeless

description: Buy the Camp Chef Pro 60X Two Burner Camp Stove online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Pro 60X Two Burner Camp Stove
hasVariant.description: Buy the Camp Chef Pro 60X Two Burner Camp Stove online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Overall I'm happy with the stove. I thought I'd jump on here and leave a long term review of this set up. I've owned the stove for approximately three years now. It's been the perfect solution to cook outside when RV camping. We utilize this with the grill box, griddle and regular stove top. I love the powerful BTUs it puts out, and the foldable portability is perfect so that we can easily fold this up and store it away in our RV's storage compartments. What I'm not pleased with is the quality of the materials/finish and I'm concerned about the stoves longevity. Like I said, I've owned this stove for about 3 years with maybe 5-10 uses a year and this unit is rarely ever exposed to wet weather the a few times a year we use it while camping. Yet, this unit is showing excessive rust/deterioration for its age in my opinion. I feel like for the price point I ought to be able to see many more years out of a stove like this before seeing it start to fall apart. We live in a dry climate so I'm surprised to see all this considering I have a Camp Chef Pellet Grill that's sat out in the sun and weather for 5 years constantly and does not show a fraction of deterioration that this stove has.
review.name: Great Stove Perfect Solution for RV Camping

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I’ve been very disappointed in this grill. The inside of the frame has become nothing but a rust bucket despite always keeping it covered (& putting away for winter) and treating with cast iron conditioner etc. so frustrating. Cooked great before I didn’t have to worry about having my tetanus shot.
review.name: Rust bucket!

review.reviewBody: Your specific needs will dictate whether this is a good cooktop for you.  I cook all kinds of things and the 30k burners are fantastic for stir fry.  I was tired of setting up 3-4 cookers to be able to cook the things I like and with the accessories this cooker can do so much.  The folding wings make good prep areas (don't put really heavy things on them) and the portability is very nice.  One of the best features is the adjustable legs.  Other grills I own (I own many) require some kind of leveling devices under the legs but this one you just screw the legs in or out.  It IS heavy so bear that in mind which limits the portability to a degree.  The carrying case is very handy IMO.  Initially I hated it but I didn't work with it enough...now I have two.  The RV quick connect would not put out enough LP to run both high output burners which was rectified by using a 20lb. tank for the cooker.  Now I have the 2nd one sitting on the patio for throwing together quick whatevers.  With the accessories (and be sure to get a good hammered steel wok) this one makes my dozen other ones more or less obsolete so they are in the barn.
review.name: Very good cooker -Takes time to familiarize

review.reviewBody:
Pro 14 two burner cooktop

Went to our inaugural Halloween bike ride and one of the guys pulled out a older version of the Pro 14 two burner cooktop and griddle.  I couldn't believe how easily it setup, cleaned up and made a ton of food for every that came that day.  It worked so well that my wife and I ordered one immediately to use on our own trips, gatherings and just some Sunday morning cookout fun.  We also purchased the two burner griddle and griddle carrying bags for both the stove and griddle, so nice to keep everything neat and sorted. 

I've only used it a couple of times so far but one thing i really noticed was how nice the burner control is, you can turn it down all the way and not worry about the burner flaming out.

My only complaint which is minor is that the flip out red lid covers don't sit completely flat like my friends did. Perhaps they will wear in with a bit more use.
review.name: It's just that easy

review.reviewBody: Since we bought this for memorial day and didn’t get a chance to use it all summer I was starting to have buyers remorse. But after using it one long weekend I’m in love. We bought the griddle and the grill accessories. One of my favorite things is that which ever one I’m not using acts is a warmer as I continue cooking other food. I literally planned an entire three day weekend of cooking around my new camp chef cooking system even though we have a camper with a stove and oven. I wasn’t sure I needed the pro with the flip out shelves but now I can’t imagine not having them. Worth every penny.
review.name: Flexibility!

review.reviewBody: I have had multiple Camp Chef Stoves.  We recently replaced an Expedition 3X with a Pro 14.  One of the features I though would be really nice is the shelves.  The only problem is when the shelves are open they are not level.  It looks like the mounting bracket for the handle which supports the shelf isn't designed properly because it angles up which makes the shelves not level.  Not sure if mine is defective (since the picture on the website looks very level) or is this is just the intended design (and the picture on the website is misleading).  I'm sure it will still cook the way I'm used to from my previous Camp Chef stoves, but I'm a little disappointed in the shelves.
review.name: Shelves are not level

review.reviewBody: Best setup I have ever had for outdoor cooking.  The accessories that go along with it make it even better.  The grill and flat top are great for making combos and taking camp meals up a notch.
review.name: Love my grill

review.reviewBody: This was a gift.  He loves it.  It is great for larger pots and pans as they fit on it easily.  The sides work well for prep space.  The extra space means that we can bring one less table.  It makes camping so much easier as water boils faster and everything cooks like it does at home.  I only wish we had it sooner.
review.name: Family Cooking on the Pro 60x

review.reviewBody: The Pro 60x is a well built high quality camp stove.  I highly recommend it.  Easy to use. Easy to clean.
review.name: Great Camp Stove

review.reviewBody: Wow great packaging but again shippers are more aware of possible damage. Storing the wind shield and the inability to close lid with it installed seemed a minor problem. HOT HOT HOT. love it and full control over heat. Tired of buying subpar stuff pay a little more and looks like a great buy.
review.name: Pro 60x

name: Pro 60X Two Burner Camp Stove
