description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Marblemount Down Parka - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Marblemount Down Parka - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Marblemount Down Parka - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I didn't read these reviews until after I ordered it - and I'm glad because they would have dissuaded me. It's a great coat! The fit does not seem small to me (same size as my old REI puffer). Sleeve length is not an issue. Love the color and it's very lightweight, packable, and warm. The best part is that the hood completely covers your hair after a blowout. It was perfect for tromping around a wet NYC in March. The zipper is a little bit iffy (so often the case with the bottom up option) thus the four instead of 5. It's only been stuck once.
review.name: Great coat at an amazing price

review.reviewBody: Zipper defective, it broke within 2 months.
review.name: Defective zipper

review.reviewBody: The zipper started giving me problems after just a few wears and it completely broke after less than a few months.  It was also way less insulated than I expected.  Even on above freezing days it was not that warm.
review.name: Bad zipper

review.reviewBody: Great jacket and everything I hoped for from a quality company!  I bought for my wife and ordered up a size because it looked to run small. My wife is 5'8'' and the sleeves on the medium were too short.  It fit everywhere else.  Unfortunately I had to return it.
review.name: Sleeves are short

review.reviewBody: Very thin with little to no insulation. Seems like poor quality for Mt Hardware. It’s too bad because the lines are nice.
review.name: Outdoorsy

review.reviewBody:
I was super stoked to get this jacket. It was time for me to upgrade and I really liked the look and color. Size large fit great on me. 
Probably two weeks into wearing this jacket the zipper started to split from the bottom very easily. So now I'm constantly messing with the zipper and don't feel like I can ever wear the jacket zipped up. It takes very little pressure to pull the zipper apart from the bottom. 
Really sucks I'm going to have to buy another coat that I can keep zipped up.
review.name: Zipper problems

review.reviewBody: I liked the fit of the coat and overall look but it splits down the zipper with any time I bent down or sat down. The zipper is very poorly made. The coat is also fairly thin and not very warm.
review.name: Bad zipper

review.reviewBody: Large fits like a medium … a not too roomy medium .
review.name: Snug

review.reviewBody: This coat weighs next to nothing and has very little down insulation. It literally feels like two pieces of nylon with almost nothing between. There was no information in the description about the fill power (650 it says on the tag) or the weight of the coat, which would have helped to indicate how much insulation it had. It might be warm down to 45 degrees or so, but then who wants a longer coat when it's that warm. I do not recommend this coat, there are much better options for the price.
review.name: Very very thin

name: Marblemount Down Parka - Women's

review.reviewBody: This best is high quality, TTS and keeps me warm on those cool days.
review.name: Complimentary with every outfit.

review.reviewBody: Bought this as a gift and she loves it. Love the color and the warmth
review.name: Great vest

review.reviewBody: This vest is just ok. I usually wear a medium but ordered size large to accommodate bulky sweaters underneath, which it does. The pockets sound like plastic/vinyl bags when I put anything in them. Being all polyester, it doesn't breathe well. It also bugs me when manufacturers put their brand name/logo in promiinent places, turning me into a walking ad. I do like the soft fleece and the colors, plus it was on sale, so I'll keep it. It will be fine around the house, for outdoor activities, and when we use the firepit.
review.name: Just ok

review.reviewBody: Fits true to size. Color is super cute. Excellent material. Cozy,warm. Perfect.
review.name: Fits true to size. Color

review.reviewBody: I’m 5’11” with a chest so I ordered a medium and I’m so glad I did. My t-shirt size is usually a small, so I decided to roll the dice and size up especially because, depending on the company, women’s sizes tend to be too short in all articles of clothing for me. The fleece is more on the thin and breathable side which is perfect for me here in Florida. I’m taking it on a trip to Glacier so we will see if it adds enough insulation while hiking. The color blocking is super cute (I got starlight) and vibrant as always and I love that the material is recycled and this clothing supports better worker’s rights.
review.name: Soft and Colorful!

review.reviewBody: i love this vest. I can tell it is going to keep me warm. I already wore it out on a chilly night. it will be great for shoulder season.
review.name: so warm and cozy

review.reviewBody: Love this vest! Warm and comfy - just what I wanted!
review.name: Teca fleece vest

review.reviewBody: Love the colors and the length ! My new favorite vest!
review.name: Bright and warm

review.reviewBody: I got this for my wife. She loved it since the moment she unwrapped it. We both love color and it was true to size.
review.name: Great write gift

review.reviewBody: Ordered medium. What I love about this vest is that it is made for petite frames.
review.name: Perfect Fit & Beautiful Colors/Style

review.reviewBody: I wore these on a rocky and wet trail this morning and they were excellent! I usually road run in minimalist shoes and was initially hesitant about running in a more cushioned shoe. But the 7mm drop on these still offered a natural feel on the trail. I found the cushion on the midsole to be super comfy under foot and I definitely noticed it help propel my legs forward with each foot strike.
review.name: Love the moderate cushion

review.itemreviewed: Last Chair Stretch Insulated Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought these for my husband for resort skiing and he loves them. He's 6'0 and slim. They fit him without being too baggy. I got him a size medium and he's a size 32-34 in the waist so seems true to size. Seemed to be jus the right amount of warmth for him too.
review.name: Great purchase!

review.itemreviewed: Last Chair Stretch Insulated Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody:
these are exactly what i was looking for. waterproof with a bit of insulation for cold days on the bike or walking around. wait maybe they aren't waterproof and i'm confusing with another pant i'm about to leave a review for... either way the insulation was the main feature i was seeking in these.

when i say these run bit i'm only referring to the length. since these are snowboard/ski pants they are designed for wear with ski/ snowboard boots hence the wide leg opening. the opening is fine for me but there is about 1" of length i could do with out. but i just roll up the heel part of the pant and it's not a problem. i'm a real 5'10" so if' wearing a small then i would be safe to say these run large. great product tho.
review.name: Last Chair - Insulated

review.itemreviewed: Last Chair Stretch Insulated Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: It is a great pant with the perfect balance of insulation and breathability for most days, love the pockets and features and specially love the fabric that is super comfortable and soft.
review.name: My new favorite snow pant

review.itemreviewed: Last Chair Stretch Insulated Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: These ski pants are nice and check all the boxes for warmth, water resistance, fit, etc. I received them and was excited until I noticed that they offer no protection for errant ski edges that will definitely cut the inner lower leg of the ski pants. I have not seen a pair of ski pants in recent years that don’t offer a protective cover to avoid cutting the ski pants lower legs. Unfortunately, I’ll be returning them even though they match my needs to a tee otherwise.
review.name: No protection on inner lower leg

name: Last Chair Stretch Insulated Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: I’ve worn these for less than two weeks. The whole sole from the toes to half way down has come unglued and just flopping. Don’t buy. Waste of money
review.name: Terrible
comment:
Hello Ryan, 
This is not what we would expect to happen with your new boots.  We do offer a 1 year limited warranty.  Please reach out if you need any assistance.  We appreciate your support.
xtratufcustomersupport@rockybrands.com

review.reviewBody:
The boot lasted a year.  I am a farmer, and I initially liked the idea that this particular boot had a bit of a better tread than most of the other xtratuf boots.  Almost on the day of the 1 year anniversary of wearing the boot every day, it began falling apart.  All of the sole welds began failing, and the sole itself began disintegrating.  I’m not certain if these boots only can last a year…but compared to longer lasting boots that I own, they are less expensive overall, and they are mostly well built.

I would buy these boots again, but I’d definitely keep the expectation low.  The boots are comfortable and they do function well…you just need to realize that they are built to handle so much abuse.
review.name: Pretty Good…But

review.reviewBody: This boot is legit!  Great price! Very comfortable! Hubbie says "BEST GIFT EVER"!!
review.name: ***FANTASTIC***

review.reviewBody: I purchased these for my son. He enjoys them when fishing. He has several boots and he likes the shorter ankle boot this time of year.

review.reviewBody:
I live in Wisconsin and have used these with windchills into the 20's and toes didn't get cold
I am size 13 U.S., size 47 EU
Good quality product
review.name: Very pleased

review.reviewBody:
My feet are always frozen, but not anymore!   These are perfect for chilly SF mornings and keep my feet nice and warm.  SF temperatures vary a lot, so I appreciate that they keep my feet warm in high 30s to low 40s, but also don't make me sweat unbearably when it warms up on the way home to high 40s/low 50s.  Relatively easy to get off and on.  

I also tried to the Estremo, which were great, but just too warm for the variety of temperatures we have in SF.
review.name: Perfect for SF winter

name: RoS 2 Shoecover

review.reviewBody: I bought these for a stage race, and first off had trouble wearing them as the band underfoot kept slipping back, the velcro was not tight enough. These trail gaiters are really solid and would work well, but if you got "skinny" ankles / legs these won't do its job.. 

Your not able to tighten these well enough.. Tried all possible options.
review.name: Trail Gaiters
comment:
Thanks for taking the time to share your valuable feedback with us.
Our customers will occasionally read these reviews, so we appreciate it when others share their experiences with us. We're genuinely sorry to hear that you're disappointed with your product 
We often make adjustments to our products based on direct customer feedback. We'll make sure to pass your feedback along to our Designers.

review.reviewBody: As a mountain and trail runner, I wear these gaiters most of the time. I like wearing them because they help keep out the rocks and debri. Alll it takes is just one pebble to make your run less enjoyable. I have never had rocks get in while wearing these!
review.name: Great for keeping the rocks out!

review.reviewBody: Fit is good and keeps my shoes free of trail debris and snow.
review.name: Do what they are made to do!

review.reviewBody: Most of my salomon gear I've been extremely happy with, but these did not live up to my expectations. The bottom strap on the gaiter constantly gets pushed back behind the heel of my shoe, and thus doesn't keep things out of my shoes like gaiters are supposed to. This has happened to me on every run and hike I've taken them on. I was really hoping I'd love these, but they are by far the worst gaiter I've owned.
review.name: I was hoping I'd like these
comment:
We appreciate you taking some time to write to us bout your experience with the gaiter and I apologize for any inconvenience caused by it. If you would like to discuss the issues with the item further please don't hesitate to reach out using the contact link below. Our team is always happy to help.

https://www.salomon.com/en-us/contact

review.reviewBody: I bought these to keep the snow and dirt out of my shoes and that's exactly what they do while I'm running or fat tire bike riding.

review.reviewBody:
Helmet is great. Backcountry is great.
Backcountry is great, helmet is great.
Fed ex sucks. I sat there staring at the delivery guy as he drove off saying he couldn’t deliver, because shop was closed. He didn’t even walk up to the door.
Just wish Backcountry would use UPS.
review.name: Giro mountain bike helmet

review.reviewBody: Good helmet for the price.  Feels good, doesn't hurt the back of my head. Can't tell from the pictures but it is a little blocky looking. The bad is the deep channel that runs right down the centerline of the helmet. it is deep and too narrow to attach a standard action camera mount. I haven't found a solution for this and night riding season is here. BUMMER
review.name: Not action camera/light mount friendly

review.reviewBody: Much better fit than prior Giro model, more protective and comfortable.
review.name: Great helmet very comfortable

review.reviewBody: This helmet fits well: it  wraps around my head nicely rather than just sitting on top (like the Smith Forefront). The Roc Loc system is super comfortable. The helmet sits lower towards the ears, and has longer coverage in the back. And it?s surprisingly super lightweight. The only con is that it may not be as ventilated as some other helmets.
review.name: Great looking helmet with good coverage
comment: Is there any room for a pony tail in the back and how comfortable is it to wear sunglasses if it sits low on your ears?

name: Source Mips Helmet

review.reviewBody: These are the best true to size bibs out there! No need to size up, these fit like a true xl should. They also have incredible pockets! 10/10

review.itemreviewed: GORE-TEX Stretch Dispatch Bib Pant - Women's
review.reviewBody: This was my first bib purchase and I love it! Fits true to size and feels so comfortable and roomy for layers. I tried it on as soon as it was delivered and I was wearing my jeans under it and it still was comfortable! It does get more fitted from the waist up but doesn’t feel restricting at all. review.reviewBody: I have both the blue and orange. The blue is a small and the orange is a medium. The medium is more in line with a size small Patagonia synchilla fleece for comparison. Super comfy and water resistant. I’ve worn it in light rain and the water just beads up on top of the fleece without seeping through.

review.reviewBody: It broke after the first wash! I washed it in a gentle + cold cycle and it came out ripped through and halfway melted. Crazy, this product material is clearly defective, will be reaching out to get a refund.

review.reviewBody: Very warm and thick fleece. My go to sweater when walking the dogs in the early morning or out on the trail. Fits runs a little smaller than traditional fleece so size up if you want a baggier look.

description: Buy the Kelty Tallboy 4 Tent: 4-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Tallboy 4 Tent: 4-Person 3-Season
hasVariant.description: Buy the Kelty Tallboy 4 Tent: 4-Person 3-Season online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
It's definitely cute and has plenty of room for two people. 

Assembly was relatively easy for the first time out at the campsite. I'd definitely recommend two people to set this up. I have a smaller backpacking tent I'll use for solo trips but I'll keep this around for car camping with my girlfriend. I much prefer the shorter sleeves and use of clips like you'd find on the wireless tents, for the poles. However on those, you don't get the same headroom. 

We were able to fit a 10 in tall Intex Queen mattress in the tent. It was a little tight with it in there but having the air mattress was worth it for a sound sleep at $30. 

As others have mentioned with this tent, ventilation is lacking while the rain cover is on. The cover is easy enough to put on and off. 4 clips to each corner of the base and it's color coded + the third center pole. 

We were in 70° day temps and 50° night temps and were pretty comfortable inside. If it was any warmer I can see it getting hot inside with the rain cover on. We were only in the tent at night however and it kept us warm and dry. 

A few pockets on the inside allow for storage of phones, wallets, glasses etc. There is a zipper on the door of the main base tent door that allows for ventilation. 

Zippers were okay, if a bit frustrating at times. You just have to finesse the rain covers on the zippers, but that's kind of annoying, ya know? I'd rather a mesh door, maybe something I'll look for in the next tent. 

We did have a night / morning of steady rain and with the rain cover ties out, it kept the tent dry. I did notice a fair bit of moisture still on the tent. Some extra wax should help. 

Packup was okay, the poles are a bit hard to get in / out of the grommets and sleeves. Big kudos to Kelty for the bag being big enough and slightly stretchy to fit everything back in easily. Packing the tent back into the bag was truly the easiest of any tent I've had. 

A shout out to Backcountry for overnighting it to me. Arrived well packaged and on time for our short notice trip. 

I'll give it 4 stars for the money, a few minor adjustments would make it better but also add to the cost I'd imagine.   A tallboy 2.0 with Aluminum poles, better ventilation, and easier assembly would be awesome.
review.name: It works

review.reviewBody: Sadly, the sleeves that the tent poles went through tore when I disassembled the tent after my first camping trip. It can be easily sewn together and I will most likely keep the tent and make the repairs myself. A common point of contention that others experienced was that the fabric around the zippers always gets caught, and I agree that this is a small design flaw that could be improved. Other than that, this tent was as listed, and the standing space in this tent is exactly what I was looking for.
review.name: Room for Improvement

review.reviewBody: While I just ordered this tent, it is exactly what I was looking for - a 4-man tent with extra height (nearly 6 feet).  I?m in my 70?s and I?ve found that shorter inside  height tents are harder to move around in, especially when dressing and undressing.  I had 2 other similar tents that lasted me 30 years but ultimately zippers and shock cord gave out.  They served their purpose well.  It looks like this Kelly tent will last well beyond me and give my kids lots of tenting fun.  By the way, I have a Kelty backpack that I bought in the mid-60?s and it?s still as good as new.
review.name: Functional Tent with Good Inside Height

name: Tallboy 4 Tent: 4-Person 3-Season
